segments.script: "Listen up, my darlings, this is an emergency broadcast from yours truly, Mr. New Vegas. A massive dust wall is bearing down on the Mojave with extreme radiation levels. Visibility will drop to zero. Seek shelter immediately in concrete structures or underground facilities like the Strip casinos, Vault entrances, or the sewers. Avoid metal buildings - they're radiation magnets. This storm will last approximately 4 hours. Stay safe and know that somebody loves you, even if it's just me."

"Good morning to you, my lovely listeners! It's 8:00 on this bright Mojave morning. The sun is just starting to peek over the horizon, casting that golden glow across our desert landscape. You know what that means - a brand new day full of possibilities!

It's me again, Mr. New Vegas, reminding you that you're nobody 'til somebody loves you. And darlings, I am here to love you through it all. So buckle up, take a deep breath of that crisp morning air, and let's make today unforgettable!"

segments.script:
Hey there Mrs. New Vegas, how's your day going? Mine's been pretty swell, just spinning some tunes and keeping it groovy out here in the Mojave Wasteland.

You know, I heard from a cat who's friends with one of the NCR soldiers that there might be some trouble brewin' at Hoover Dam. Word is, those Legion fanatics have been causin' some ruckus on the other side, maybe even tryin' to infiltrate. But don't you worry, our boys and girls in blue are always ready for a scrap.

On another note, someone told me that a group of trappers out near Bitter Springs have come across some pretty rare caps stash. Now, I ain't one to spread rumors, but if it's true, those trappers might be sittin' on quite the fortune! Always nice to find some extra caps in this harsh wasteland life.

Well, that's all for now, my dear. Just a couple tidbits of gossip to keep things interesting out here. Remember, until somebody loves you, you're nobody at all - and if you ever need any lovin' vibes, just tune into Radio Appalachia anytime! Your DJ, Mr. New Vegas, signing off.
